neighbors.name: Gregg A. Komplin
neighbors.claims: Gregg A. Komplin is listed as an alumnus of Madison West High School’s class of 1976 ([www.regents76.net](https://www.regents76.net/update-your-info/#:~:text=...,Mike%20Koppa%20%E2%80%93)). No references to Komplin were found in local government minutes or news archives, suggesting he has not been publicly active in civic affairs ([townoforegonwi.gov](https://townoforegonwi.gov/plan-commission-submittals/#:~:text=No%20,komplin)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a fellow farmer or agricultural advisor reach out, highlighting how the project can respect his farmland and address any drainage or access concerns in a way that aligns with preserving his property.

neighbors.name: Jason D. Kelley
neighbors.claims: Jason D. Kelley appears as a property owner in county records, but no public-facing information (e.g. meeting participation or letters) could be found under his name ([townoforegonwi.gov](https://townoforegonwi.gov/plan-commission-submittals/#:~:text=No%20,kelley)). This suggests he has a very limited public profile in the community.

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in person in a neighborly manner, reassuring him that the development will not negatively impact his property value or peace and quiet. Emphasize maintaining the local quality of life to build trust.

neighbors.name: Gerald R. Hahn
neighbors.claims: Gerald R. Hahn’s family has longstanding ties to local farming; a 2022 zoning petition by Kevin W. Hahn (likely a relative) sought to split a farmhouse from their Rutland farmland ([dane.legistar.com](https://dane.legistar.com/MeetingDetail.aspx?GUID=7C6BF6A9-905C-4057-9538-0E71F17478AE&ID=959113&Options=&Search=#:~:text=11853%201%20%C2%A0%20Rutland%20,recommended%20for%20approval%20Pass%20Action%C2%A0details)). Kevin W. Hahn also serves as a Town of Rutland constable ([town.rutland.wi.us](https://town.rutland.wi.us/constables/#:~:text=Constables%20,5607)), indicating the Hahn family’s active presence in the community.
neighbors.influence_justification: Longtime farm family; minor town role

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage via trusted local officials or agri-community leaders who acknowledge the Hahn family’s generations in the area. Emphasize how the project will respect their farm legacy and maintain local control over important land-use decisions.

overview_summary: None of these three neighbors have a clearly documented stance on development or clean energy, so all are classified as "unknown" in that regard. Their community influence is generally limited: two maintain a low profile, and only one (the Hahn family) shows moderate local engagement through minor civic roles.
